title: Sun square Mars
summary: A high-friction alignment between intention and execution. Motivation is strong, but resistance-internal or external-forces choices about timing, direction, and restraint. The task is to act without burning momentum.

meaning.headline: Pressure builds where desire meets resistance.

frames.text: Sun-Mars squares create urgency without clear release, surfacing impatience when progress feels blocked.
This is activation energy: how you respond to friction matters more than how fast you move.
Conflict often reveals misalignment between intention and available capacity.
Physical energy may spike before strategy catches up.

frictions: Impatience with obstacles or other people
opportunities: Clarifying which battles are worth energy

do: Pause before acting and ask what outcome you're actually pushing for.
Choose one priority and direct energy there.
Use physical movement to discharge excess tension.
Break actions into short, controlled bursts.
Adjust tactics instead of doubling down automatically.
avoid: Ignoring signs of fatigue or strain

reusable_lines.text: Friction doesn't mean stop-it means steer.
How you apply force matters more than how much you have.

allowed_framing: Agency-based framing: 'you can choose how to respond'
Contextual framing: 'depending on stress levels and demands...'

sources: Sun-Mars square as will/action tension archetype
